channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Judge dismisses FTC’s initial antitrust complaint against Facebook
item.description: A federal judge has dismissed the FTC’s initial antitrust complaint against Facebook, saying it was “legally insufficient.”

item.title: Watch Samsung's MWC event in four minutes
item.description: Get your eyes on the latest One UI smartwatch interface.

item.title: The Windows 11 preview can dynamically change your refresh rate to save battery
item.description: As the name suggests, DRR will lower your laptop's refresh rate to 60Hz when you're doing things like writing emails and documents and then increase it to 120Hz when inking and scrolling so that those interactions feel more instantaneous.

item.title: Senator proposes law to safeguard journalists’ data from the government
item.description: Senator Ron Wyden proposes a federal shield law for journalists that would prevent their records from being seized.

item.title: Get up to 25 courses on how to code in different languages
item.description: The 2021 Ultimate Learn to Code Training features expert courses on programming in a variety of languages and niches.

item.title: 'Nier Reincarnation' comes to mobile on July 28th
item.description: Nier fans won't have to wait much longer to play the franchise's first mobile spin-off.

item.title: Samsung's new Wear OS watch will debut at Unpacked this summer
item.description: Samsung will launch the first Galaxy Watch running Wear OS with its One UI Watch interface at Unpacked this summer.

item.title: Samsung unveils new One UI Watch experience for Wear OS
item.description: Samsung showed off a smartwatch interface called One UI Watch today, based on the new Wear OS it co-engineered with Google.

item.title: Microsoft rolls out the first Windows 11 preview
item.description: Windows fans and developers can get their first taste of Windows 11 today, as Microsoft has begun rolling out the first preview for Windows Insiders.

item.title: Juul will pay $40 million to settle a vaping lawsuit in North Carolina
item.description: Several other states have sued the company, alleging that it marketed products to teens.

item.title: Heineken made a cute but garish autonomous beer cooler
item.description: Meet the Beer Outdoor Transporter or BOT from Heineken.

item.title: How to watch today's Samsung Wear OS event
item.description: Samsung is holding its Wear OS event at Mobile World Congress at 1:15PM Eastern — here's how to watch and see the first fruits of the Google team-up.

item.title: YouTube to open a 6,000-seat live entertainment arena in California
item.description: YouTube is opening a three-story, 6,000-seat live arena for concerts, esports and creator events at Hollywood Park in Inglewood, California.

item.title: YouTube TV now supports 4K streaming, but it comes at a price
item.description: Starting today, YouTube TV will have a new add-on called "4K Plus." As the name suggests, it'll enable 4K streaming, assuming you have a compatible TV and streaming device. The 4K Plus add-on also includes the ability to download recordings from your DVR to a phone or tablet, a feature that should be pretty useful for people as they start traveling more this summer.

item.title: How I inadvertently became a vinyl nerd
item.description: I became a vinyl nerd this year and purchased the U-Turn Audio Orbit Plus turntable and the Kanto YU4 powered speakers.

item.title: Issac Asimov’s 'Foundation' lands on Apple TV+ September 24
item.description: Take a peek at the latest action-packed trailer for the sci-fi saga.

item.title: This $15 art program specializes in digital painting
item.description: Paintstorm Studio is designed specifically for digital painting and comes with a large menu of brushes and life-like underlayer blending.

item.title: Amazon cashes in on the vinyl resurgence with record of the month club
item.description: For $25/month, you'll get a classic album from the '60s and '70s every 30 days or so.

item.title: Honda's first electric SUV will be called the Prologue
item.description: Honda has revealed that its first electric SUV is named the Prologue, and will arrive in early 2024 alongside an Acura model.

item.title: Qualcomm's Snapdragon 888 Plus will come to high-end phones made by ASUS and Motorola
item.description: Qualcomm has introduced a Snapdragon 888 Plus chip that promises faster clock speeds and AI for flagship smartphones from ASUS, Motorola and beyond.

item.title: Netflix lets Android users watch partially downloaded shows
item.description: Netflix will let you start watching shows and movies even if they never finished downloading.

item.title: TCL's latest 20-Series phones are now available in the US
item.description: TCL's 20-Series phones are available in the US.

item.title: The Morning After: You can hang up Lenovo's new tablet
item.description: Today’s headlines: YouTube took down videos documenting Xinjiang human rights abuses, Lenovo's new Yoga Tabs have kickstands that double as hangers, and Apple may be exploring even bigger iPad designs.

item.title: Autonomous Mission Master XT can haul over a ton of supplies into war zones
item.description: Armies want autonomous vehicles to reduce the risk and workload for soldiers, and a new model is a prime example of how that will work.

item.title: The world's fastest electric motorcycle has a new aerodynamic challenger
item.description: White Motorcycle Concepts is targeting an Electric motorcycle land speed record with its WMC250EV concept.
